name: Gomphrena
description: Gomphrena is a genus of more than 100 species of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae, distributed throughout the warm temperate, subtropical and tropical regions of the world.The genus includes low-growing annuals and perennials that bloom in shades of white, yellow, pink, orange, red and purple. Some of the species are used as medicinal plants and a few are cultivated as ornamentals. These plants are drought tolerant and easy to grow. They are suitable for beds, borders, pots and window boxes, and are great for fresh-cut and dried floral arrangements.
meaning: The genus name is derived from the Latin word “gromphaena”, a name apparently used for Amaranthus tricolor.
color_description: The flowers come in various colors including white, yellow, pink, orange, red and purple.
